input: No Party shall provide export credits, export credit guarantees, or insurance for any project that would directly support the construction of a new coal-fired power generating facility, except where the Party determines this is necessary to address energy poverty in least developed countries.
note: Blends trade (export credits) with environment (coal restriction) - PRIMARY is trade mechanism

input: States Parties shall ensure that autonomous weapons systems are subject to meaningful human control at all stages of their operational lifecycle, including target selection, engagement decisions, and post-strike assessment.
note: Blends arms control with AI governance - PRIMARY is weapons regulation

input: Each Party shall ensure that its intellectual property regime provides adequate protection for traditional knowledge and genetic resources, with the free, prior and informed consent of indigenous communities as a prerequisite for any commercial use.
note: Blends trade (IP) with human rights (indigenous rights) - PRIMARY is IP framework

input: Parties shall impose targeted financial sanctions, including asset freezes and transaction prohibitions, on individuals and entities responsible for gross violations of human rights in connection with the systematic use of forced labor.
note: Blends trade (sanctions) with human rights - PRIMARY is human rights enforcement

input: High-risk AI systems used in migration and border control shall not be deployed in a manner that results in discrimination based on race, ethnicity, religion, or national origin, and shall be subject to regular algorithmic audits by independent bodies.
note: Blends AI governance with human rights (non-discrimination) - PRIMARY is AI regulation

input: States Parties undertake not to develop, produce, or deploy space-based weapons or weapons systems designed to destroy, damage, or interfere with objects in outer space, except for those necessary for peaceful scientific research purposes.
note: Arms control with space law elements - PRIMARY is weapons prohibition

input: Each Party shall ensure that market surveillance authorities have access to the source code and training data of AI systems where necessary to assess conformity with safety requirements and fundamental rights protections.
note: Blends AI governance with trade (market surveillance) - PRIMARY is AI oversight

input: Developed country Parties shall provide technology transfer and capacity building support to developing country Parties for the development of clean energy infrastructure, subject to adequate protection of intellectual property rights.
note: Blends environment with trade (tech transfer, IP) - PRIMARY is climate/energy

input: Parties shall take all necessary measures to prevent the transfer of dual-use cyber surveillance technologies to countries with a documented record of using such technologies for human rights violations.
note: Blends arms control (dual-use) with human rights and cyber - PRIMARY is export control

input: States Parties shall ensure that workers displaced by the transition to a low-carbon economy receive adequate social protection, retraining opportunities, and support for alternative employment in accordance with just transition principles.
note: Blends environment with human rights (labor) - PRIMARY is climate transition

input: Each Party shall maintain a register of beneficial owners of companies involved in the extraction, processing, or trade of conflict minerals, and shall make this information available to other Parties upon request.
note: Blends trade with human rights (conflict minerals) - PRIMARY is trade transparency

input: Parties shall prohibit the development of lethal autonomous weapons systems that select and engage targets without meaningful human control, recognizing the fundamental importance of human dignity in decisions concerning life and death.
note: Blends arms control with human rights (dignity) and AI - PRIMARY is weapons ban

input: AI systems used in criminal justice, including risk assessment tools and predictive policing systems, shall be subject to mandatory impact assessments for discriminatory effects prior to deployment.
note: Blends AI governance with human rights (fair trial) - PRIMARY is AI regulation

input: States Parties shall cooperate to prevent the financing of terrorism through the trade in wildlife and natural resources, including ivory, timber, and precious minerals.
note: Blends environment with arms control (terrorism) and trade - PRIMARY is wildlife protection

input: Each Party shall ensure that cross-border data flows necessary for the provision of financial services are not restricted, provided that appropriate safeguards for personal data protection are maintained.
note: Blends trade (services) with AI governance (data) - PRIMARY is trade in services
